title: Linux cupsd Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the CUPS printing system and learn how to manage printers using the cupsd command. Configure printer settings and gain practical experience with this essential Linux utility.

meta.title: Linux cupsd Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the CUPS printing system and learn how to manage printers using the cupsd command. Configure printer settings and gain practical experience with this essential Linux utility.
meta.keywords: CUPS, cupsd, printing, printer management, Linux utilities

verify.name: Verify CUPS service status
verify.hint: The CUPS service should be active and running on the system. Please check the service status and ensure it is in the "active (running)" state.

steps.title: Manage Printers Using the cupsd Command

verify.name: Verify printer creation
verify.hint: The 'MyPrinter' printer should be listed in the output of the 'sudo cupsd -t' command.

verify.name: Verify printer configuration
verify.hint: The printer should have the default paper size set to "a4" and the printer should be in the "paused" state.
